{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3370615,"name":"Ohlin Arellano","username":"ohlin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ohlin/{size}/208803_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-23T06:32:37.764Z","cooked":"

With our season coming to an end, it’s that time again to make our code public. Our repository can be found here.

This season has been a major upgrade for programming on our team, and we’ve hit a few milestones on the way, most notably our first competition-ready swerve (via CTRE’s template) and our first use of PathPlanner for autonomous.

One of the biggest challenges this year was PID tuning. We spent the majority of some days in our shop just playing around with the values, specifically on our arm and elevator. To this day, I still feel that maybe there is something we’re missing, and I’d love to hear what steps other teams take to tune, and how long others spend overall tuning.

From here, we hope to spend our offseason exploring AdvantageKit, vison-based odometry, and conquering PID tuning on our swerve and other subsystems.

With that, I’ve put a lot of time into learning how I can further my team’s programming knowledge, and I hope to add onto that as much as possible before I graduate. Any feedback is greatly appreciated (code review, advice, etc.), and I would love to see other teams’ code from this year if others are open to sharing.

I hope this code can serve as a resource, thanks all for an incredible season!
